00001 //_____________________________________________
00002 //
00003 // KHLAEvent.cxx
00004 // KDataStructure
00005 //
00006 // Author: Adam Cox <mailto:adam.cox@ik.fzk.de>
00007 //
00008 // * Copyright 2010 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. All rights reserved.
00009 //
00010 // This is the main Event class for High Level Analysis. One typically
00011 // begins all analysis by getting a pointer to this object from 
00012 // the KDataReader object. By calling KDataReader::GetEntry(Int_t i)
00013 // or KDataReader::GetNextEntry, one can loop through the KDS data
00014 // file and examine each event separately. From this HLAEvent object
00015 // one can obtain pointers to they Muon and Bolometer System Records
00016 // GetBoloSystemRecord(void), GetMuonVetoSystemRecord()
00017 // and to each of the event's Sub Records. 
00018 
00019 #include "KHLAEvent.h"
00020 #include "KRawEvent.h"
00021 
00022 #include "TProcessID.h"
00023 
00024 //system Record Includes
00025 //#include "KHLABoloSysRecord.h"
00026 //#include "KHLAMuonVetoSysRecord.h"
00027 
00028 //sub record includes
00029 #include "TClonesArray.h"
00030 #include "KHLASambaRecord.h"
00031 #include "KHLABolometerRecord.h"
00032 #include "KHLABoloPulseRecord.h"
00033 #include "KHLAMuonModuleRecord.h"
00034 #include <iostream>
00035 
00036 using namespace std;

00038 ClassImp(KHLAEvent);
00039 
00040 KHLAEvent::KHLAEvent(void)
00041 {
00042         //Default Constructor. This allocates memory for the TClonesArrays
00043         //and this might be a bug/memory leak. According to the ROOT documentation
00044         //no memory should be allocated by the default constructor. This needs
00045         //to be checked.
00046         //
00047         //If you are creating your own KHLAEvent object for use outside 
00048         //of ROOT I/O, it is strongly encouraged that you use the KEventFactory
00049         //to make the object for you. It is intended that if the KHLAEvent
00050         //needs to be built in a more complex way, by always asking the KEventFactory
00051         //to build an event object for you, you are guaranteed to get a fully
00052         //created object (assuming that the KEventFactory is properly coded. :)
00053         
00054         //HLAEvent members that are on the STACK
00055         InitializeMembers();
00056         
00057         //TClonesArray Initializations must be done separately.
00058         //as well as any other members that are created on the heap/free store
00059         fNumSamba = 0;
00060         fNumBolo = 0;
00061         fNumBoloPulse = 0;
00062         fNumMuonModule = 0;
00063         
00064         fSamba = 0;
00065         fBolo = 0;
00066         fBoloPulse = 0;
00067         fMuonModule = 0;
00068         
00069         CreateArrays();
00070 }
00071 
00072 KHLAEvent::KHLAEvent(const KHLAEvent &anEvent)
00073 : KEvent(anEvent)
00074 {
00075         //Copy Constructor. The TRefs will point to newly created objects
00076         //and not to the data members of the KHLAEvent object you passed in.
00077         
00078         CopyLocalMembers(anEvent);
00079         
00080         //MUST copy all TRef's appropriately to the new file. Otherwise
00081         //they will point to records in a different File! This is 
00082         //why I use the copyClonesArray method here instead of
00083         //using TClonesArray's copy constructors. 
00084         fNumSamba = 0;
00085         fNumBolo = 0;
00086         fNumBoloPulse = 0;
00087         fNumMuonModule = 0;
00088         
00089         fSamba = 0;
00090         fBolo = 0;
00091         fBoloPulse = 0;
00092         fMuonModule = 0;
00093         CreateArrays();
00094 
00095         CopyClonesArrays(anEvent);
00096 }
00097 
00098 KHLAEvent::~KHLAEvent(void) 
00099 {
00100         
00101         Clear("C");
00102         
00103         //Delete TClonesArrays
00104         if(fSamba) delete fSamba;
00105         fSamba = 0;
00106         
00107         if(fBolo) delete fBolo;
00108         fBolo = 0;
00109         
00110         if(fBoloPulse) delete fBoloPulse;
00111         fBoloPulse = 0;
00112         
00113         if(fMuonModule) delete fMuonModule;
00114         fMuonModule = 0;
00115         
00116         if(fSamba != 0) cout << "WTF!" <<endl;
00117         
00118         
00119 }

00121 KHLAEvent& KHLAEvent::operator=(const KEvent &anEvent)
00122 {
00123 #ifdef _K_DEBUG_EVENT_ASSIGNOP
00124         cout << "hla = base" << endl;
00125 #endif
00126         
00127         //assigns the data member values of an KEvent object into the KHLAEvent. 
00128         if(&anEvent == this) return *this;
00129 
00130         
00131         try {
00132                 const KRawEvent &rhs = dynamic_cast<const KRawEvent&>(anEvent);
00133                 this->operator=(rhs);
00134                 
00135         }
00136         catch(bad_cast) {
00137                 
00138                 try{
00139                         const KHLAEvent &rhs = dynamic_cast<const KHLAEvent&>(anEvent);
00140                         this->operator=(rhs);
00141                 }
00142                 
00143                 catch(bad_cast) {
00144                         this->KEvent::operator=(anEvent);
00145                 }
00146         }
00147         
00148 
00149         return *this;
00150 }
00151 
00152 KHLAEvent& KHLAEvent::operator=(const KRawEvent &anEvent)
00153 {
00154         //assigns the data member values of an KRawEvent into this KHLAEvent.
00155         //calls this->CopyFromRawEvent
00156         
00157 #ifdef _K_DEBUG_EVENT_ASSIGNOP
00158         cout << "hla = raw" << endl;
00159 #endif
00160         try {
00161                 const KEvent &rhs = dynamic_cast<const KEvent&>(anEvent);
00162                 if(&rhs == this) return *this;
00163                 
00164                 this->KEvent::operator=(rhs);
00165                 CopyFromRawEvent(anEvent);
00166         }
00167         catch (bad_cast) {
00168                 //do nothing... although, maybe should do something
00169                 //because it should be totally strange if this doesn't throw.
00170         }
00171         
00172         return *this;
00173 }
00174 
00175 
00176 KHLAEvent& KHLAEvent::operator=(const KHLAEvent &anEvent)
00177 {
00178         //sets anEvent to this. 
00179         
00180 #ifdef _K_DEBUG_EVENT_ASSIGNOP
00181         cout << "hla = hla" << endl;
00182 #endif
00183         if(&anEvent == this) return *this;
00184         
00185         this->KEvent::operator=(anEvent);
00186         
00187         CopyLocalMembers(anEvent);
00188         CopyClonesArrays(anEvent);
00189 
00190         return *this;
00191 }
00192 
00193 void KHLAEvent::CopyClonesArrays(const KHLAEvent &anEvent)
00194 {
00195         //
00196         //ClonesArray assignment doesn't appear to work in the following way
00197         //*fSamba = *anEvent.GetSambaRecords();
00198         //*fBolo = *anEvent.GetBoloSubRecords();
00199         //*fBoloPulse = *anEvent.GetBoloPulseRecords();
00200         //*fMuonModule = *anEvent.GetMuonModuleRecords();
00201         //
00202         //so, I just clear this object's array, and create as many objects as I need.
00203         //this might be inefficient, but I don't think so. besides,
00204         //we likely won't be creating many many instances of the Event class.
00205         //at least, we shouldn't do that. 
00206         //if your code is really slow and you think it has something
00207         //to do with copying HLAEvents, look here for possible fixes. 
00208         //
00209         //MUST copy all TRef's appropriately to the new file. Otherwise
00210         //they will point to records in a different File!
00211 
00212         ClearArrays("C");
00213         
00214         Int_t ObjectNumber = TProcessID::GetObjectCount();
00215         /*
00216         for(Int_t i = 0; i < anEvent.GetNumSambas(); i++){
00217                 KHLASambaRecord *s = AddSamba();
00218                 KHLASambaRecord *sO = anEvent.GetSamba(i);
00219                 if(s != 0 && sO != 0) 
00220                         *s = *sO;
00221                 else
00222                         cout << "KHLAEvent::operator= Invalid Samba Pointer" << endl;
00223         }
00224         */
00225         //UNFORTUNATELY, WE CAN'T PUT THE COPYING OF THE TREF'D SAMBA
00226         //OBJECT INSIDE OF THE SINGLEBOLO ASSIGNMENT OPERATOR METHOD
00227         //BECAUSE EACH SAMBA RECORD MUST BE ADDED TO THE EVENT. 
00228         
00229         for(Int_t i = 0; i < anEvent.GetNumBolos(); i++){
00230                 KHLABolometerRecord *bolo = AddBolo();
00231                 KHLABolometerRecord *boloO = anEvent.GetBolo(i);
00232                 KHLASambaRecord *sambaO = boloO->GetSambaRecord();
00233                 KHLASambaRecord *samba = 0;
00234                 
00235                 if(bolo != 0 && boloO != 0) 
00236                         *bolo = *boloO;
00237                 else
00238                         cout << "KHLAEvent::operator= Invalid SingleBolo Pointer" << endl;
00239                 
00240                 if(sambaO != 0) {
00241                         samba = AddSamba();
00242                         *samba = *sambaO;
00243                         if(samba) bolo->SetSambaRecord(samba);
00244                 }
00245                 //else
00246                         //cout << "KHLAEvent::operator= Invalid Samba Pointer" << endl;
00247                         //no need to print out an error message here. it may be the desired
00248                         //behavior that there is not an associated samba record. 
00249                 
00250         }
00251         
00252         //EVENTUALLY, THE BOLO PULSES WILL HAVE TO BE ADDED
00253         //AND LINKED VIA THE TREF IN THE SAME WAY THAT THE SAMBA
00254         //RECORD IS DONE ABOVE, INSTEAD OF THIS CURRENT METHOD THAT
00255         //DOESN'T PRESERVE PROPER TREF LINKING TO THIS EVENT
00256         for(Int_t i = 0; i < anEvent.GetNumBoloPulses(); i++){
00257                 KHLABoloPulseRecord *s = AddBoloPulse();
00258                 KHLABoloPulseRecord *sO = anEvent.GetBoloPulse(i);
00259                 if(s != 0 && sO != 0) 
00260                         *s = *sO;
00261                 else
00262                         cout << "KHLAEvent::operator= Invalid BoloPulse Pointer" << endl;
00263         }
00264         
00265         for(Int_t i = 0; i < anEvent.GetNumMuonModules(); i++){
00266                 KHLAMuonModuleRecord *s = AddMuonModule();
00267                 KHLAMuonModuleRecord *sO = anEvent.GetMuonModule(i);
00268                 if(s != 0 && sO != 0) 
00269                         *s = *sO;
00270                 else
00271                         cout << "KHLAEvent::operator= Invalid MuonModule Pointer" << endl;
00272         }
00273         
00274         //Restore Object count                                                                                                     
00275         //To save space in the table keeping track of all referenced objects 
00276         //and computation time,
00277         //we assume that our events DO NOT address each other. We reset the                                                        
00278         //object count to what it was at the beginning of the event.                                                               
00279         TProcessID::SetObjectCount(ObjectNumber);
00280         
00281 }

00283 void KHLAEvent::CopyLocalMembers(const KHLAEvent &anEvent)
00284 {
00285         //fDataCleaningWord = anEvent.fDataCleaningWord;
00286         fBoloSystem = anEvent.fBoloSystem; 
00287         fMuonSystem = anEvent.fMuonSystem;
00288         fNumSamba = anEvent.fNumSamba;
00289         fNumBolo = anEvent.fNumBolo;
00290         fNumBoloPulse = anEvent.fNumBoloPulse;
00291         fNumMuonModule = anEvent.fNumMuonModule;
00292         
00293 }

00305 void KHLAEvent::ClearArrays(Option_t *anOption)
00306 {
00307         ClearArray(anOption, fSamba,fNumSamba);
00308         ClearArray(anOption, fBolo,fNumBolo);
00309         ClearArray(anOption, fBoloPulse,fNumBoloPulse);
00310         ClearArray(anOption, fMuonModule,fNumMuonModule);
00311 }
00312 
00313 void KHLAEvent::Clear(Option_t *anOption)
00314 {
00315         
00316         ClearArrays(anOption);
00317         //delete any memory allocated by the KEvent class here that
00318         //needs to be deleted for each event -- but not the TClonesArrays. Clear should be called 
00319         //after every event so that the TClonesArrays are cleared. 
00320         KEvent::Clear(anOption);
00321         
00322         //Call the System Record clears in case they need to clean up
00323         //or to reset initial values of member variables
00324         fBoloSystem.Clear(anOption);
00325         fMuonSystem.Clear(anOption);
00326         
00327         //reset member variables to zero
00328         InitializeMembers();
00329                                                                                                                                  
00330 }

00335         //SetDataType(kHLADataType);
00336         
00337 }
00338 
00339 void KHLAEvent::CreateArrays(void)
00340 {
00341         //Allocates memory for the TClonesArrays if they haven't already
00342         //been allocated.
00343         
00344         if(!fSamba)
00345                 fSamba = new TClonesArray("KHLASambaRecord",5);
00346         
00347         if(!fBolo)
00348                 fBolo = new TClonesArray("KHLABolometerRecord",5);
00349         
00350         if(!fBoloPulse)
00351                 fBoloPulse = new TClonesArray("KHLABoloPulseRecord",10);
00352         
00353         if(!fMuonModule)
00354                 fMuonModule = new TClonesArray("KHLAMuonModuleRecord",5);
00355 
00356         
00357         //why doesn't this create a memory leak? CreateArrays is called
00358         //by the default constructor. Does ROOT realize that I already 
00359         //have these TClonesArrays. Or maybe a TClonesArray object doesn't
00360         //require that much memory, so I don't notice the leak.
00361 }
00362 
00363 void KHLAEvent::ClearArray(Option_t *anOption, TClonesArray *mArray, Int_t &mCount)
00364 {
00365         if(mArray) {
00366                 mArray->Clear( (anOption && *anOption) ? anOption : "C" );
00367                 //we have to delete because our sub-records contain TString members! :(
00368                 //mArray->Delete( (anOption && *anOption) ? anOption : "C" );
00369                 mCount = 0;
00370         }
00371 }
00372 
00373 template<class T> T* KHLAEvent::AddSubRecord(TClonesArray *mArray, Int_t &mCount)
00374 {
00375         TClonesArray &mArrayRef = *mArray;
00376         T* mNewSubRecord = new(mArrayRef[mCount++]) T;
00377         return mNewSubRecord;
00378 }

00380 KHLASambaRecord* KHLAEvent::AddSamba(void)
00381 {
00382         //Use this event only when creating an event and you want to add
00383         //a new SubRecord.
00384         
00385         return AddSubRecord<KHLASambaRecord>(fSamba,fNumSamba);
00386 }
00387 
00388 KHLABolometerRecord* KHLAEvent::AddBolo(void)
00389 {
00390         //Use this event only when creating an event and you want to add
00391         //a new SubRecord.
00392         
00393         AddTriggerType(kBoloTriggerType);
00394         return AddSubRecord<KHLABolometerRecord>(fBolo,fNumBolo);
00395 }

00414 KHLASambaRecord *KHLAEvent::GetSamba(Int_t i) const
00415 {
00416   // Return the i'th Samba Sub Record for this event.
00417         
00418   KHLASambaRecord *ms = 0;
00419   if (i < fNumSamba) ms = (KHLASambaRecord *)fSamba->At(i);
00420   return ms;
00421 }
00422 
00423 KHLABolometerRecord *KHLAEvent::GetBolo(Int_t i) const
00424 {
00425   // Return the i'th Bolometer Sub Record for this event.
00426         
00427   KHLABolometerRecord *ms = 0;
00428   if (i < fNumBolo) ms = (KHLABolometerRecord *)fBolo->At(i);
00429   return ms;
00430 }
00431 
00432 KHLABoloPulseRecord *KHLAEvent::GetBoloPulse(Int_t i) const

00437   if (i < fNumBoloPulse) ms = (KHLABoloPulseRecord *)fBoloPulse->At(i);

00450 Bool_t KHLAEvent::IsSame(const KHLAEvent &anEvent, Bool_t bPrint) const
00451 {
00452         //Compares two KHLAEvents and their member variables to test for equality.
00453         //If bPrint is set to true, then a message for each member variable that is different
00454         //will print to standard out. Otherwise, this method will return false and quit
00455         //checking member variables as soon as it finds a unequal data member.
00456         
00457         Bool_t bIsEqual = true; //assume its true, then test for differences
00458         
00459         //call the base class's IsSame methods
00460         if(!this->KEvent::IsSame(anEvent,bPrint)){
00461                 if (bPrint) 
00462                 bIsEqual = false;
00463                 if(!bPrint)
00464                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00465                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00466         }
00467         
00468         /*if(fDataCleaningWord != anEvent.fDataCleaningWord){
00469                 if (bPrint) 
00470                         cout << "KHLAEvent fDataCleaningWord Not Equal" << endl;                
00471                 bIsEqual = false;
00472                 if(!bPrint)
00473                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00474                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00475         }*/
00476         
00477         if(!fBoloSystem.IsSame(anEvent.fBoloSystem, bPrint)){
00478                 if (bPrint) 
00479                         cout << "KHLAEvent fBoloSystem Not Equal" << endl;              
00480                 bIsEqual = false;
00481                 if(!bPrint)
00482                         return false;
00483         }
00484          
00485         if(!fMuonSystem.IsSame(anEvent.fMuonSystem, bPrint)){
00486                 if (bPrint) 
00487                         cout << "KHLAEvent fMuonSystem Not Equal" << endl;              
00488                 bIsEqual = false;
00489                 if(!bPrint)
00490                         return false;
00491         }
00492         
00493         if(fNumSamba == anEvent.fNumSamba){
00494                 for(Int_t i = 0; i < fNumSamba; i++){
00495                         KHLASambaRecord *s = GetSamba(i);
00496                         KHLASambaRecord *sOther = anEvent.GetSamba(i);
00497                         if(s != 0 && sOther != 0){
00498                                 if(!s->IsSame(*sOther, bPrint)){
00499                                         if (bPrint) 
00500                                                 cout << "KHLAEvent KHLASambaRecord number " << i << " Not Equal" << endl;               
00501                                         bIsEqual = false;
00502                                         if(!bPrint)
00503                                                 return false;
00504                                 }
00505                         }
00506                 }
00507         }
00508         else {
00509                 if (bPrint) 
00510                         cout << "KHLAEvent fNumSamba Not Equal" << endl;                
00511                 bIsEqual = false;
00512                 if(!bPrint)
00513                         return false;
00514         }
00515         
00516         if(fNumBolo == anEvent.fNumBolo){
00517                 for(Int_t i = 0; i < fNumBolo; i++){
00518                         KHLABolometerRecord *s = GetBolo(i);
00519                         KHLABolometerRecord *sOther = anEvent.GetBolo(i);
00520                         if(s != 0 && sOther != 0){
00521                                 if(!s->IsSame(*sOther, bPrint)){
00522                                         if (bPrint) 
00523                                                 cout << "KHLAEvent KHLABolometerRecord number " << i << " Not Equal" << endl;           
00524                                         bIsEqual = false;
00525                                         if(!bPrint)
00526                                                 return false;
00527                                 }
00528                         }
00529                 }
00530         }
00531         else {
00532                 if (bPrint) 
00533                         cout << "KHLAEvent fNumBolo Not Equal" << endl;         
00534                 bIsEqual = false;
00535                 if(!bPrint)
00536                         return false;
00537         }
00538         
00539         if(fNumBoloPulse == anEvent.fNumBoloPulse){
00540                 for(Int_t i = 0; i < fNumBoloPulse; i++){
00541                         KHLABoloPulseRecord *s = GetBoloPulse(i);
00542                         KHLABoloPulseRecord *sOther = anEvent.GetBoloPulse(i);
00543                         if(s != 0 && sOther != 0){
00544                                 if(!s->IsSame(*sOther, bPrint)){
00545                                         if (bPrint) 
00546                                                 cout << "KHLAEvent KHLABoloPulseRecord number " << i << " Not Equal" << endl;           
00547                                         bIsEqual = false;
00548                                         if(!bPrint)
00549                                                 return false;
00550                                 }
00551                         }
00552                 }
00553         }
00554         else {
00555                 if (bPrint) 
00556                         cout << "KHLAEvent fNumBoloPulse Not Equal" << endl;            
00557                 bIsEqual = false;
00558                 if(!bPrint)
00559                         return false;
00560         }
00561         
00562         if(fNumMuonModule == anEvent.fNumMuonModule){
00563                 for(Int_t i = 0; i < fNumMuonModule; i++){
00564                         KHLAMuonModuleRecord *s = GetMuonModule(i);
00565                         KHLAMuonModuleRecord *sOther = anEvent.GetMuonModule(i);
00566                         if(s != 0 && sOther != 0){
00567                                 if(!s->IsSame(*sOther, bPrint)){
00568                                         if (bPrint) 
00569                                                 cout << "KHLAEvent KHLABoloPulseRecord number " << i << " Not Equal" << endl;           
00570                                         bIsEqual = false;
00571                                         if(!bPrint)
00572                                                 return false;
00573                                 }
00574                         }
00575                 }
00576         }
00577         else {
00578                 if (bPrint) 
00579                         cout << "KHLAEvent fNumMuonModule Not Equal" << endl;           
00580                 bIsEqual = false;
00581                 if(!bPrint)
00582                         return false;
00583         }
00584                 
00585         return bIsEqual;
00586 }

00596 
00597 void KHLAEvent::Compact(void)
00598 {
00599         //Make the event class as small as possible. This calls 'Compact' for all member
00600         //variables that are KDS classes, member variables that can be compacted (such as TBits)
00601         //and base classes
00602         
00603         KEvent::Compact();
00604         
00605         fBoloSystem.Compact();
00606         fMuonSystem.Compact();
00607         
00608         for(Int_t i = 0; i < GetNumSambas(); i++){
00609                 KHLASambaRecord* samba = GetSamba(i);
00610                 samba->Compact();
00611         }
00612         for(Int_t i = 0; i < GetNumBolos(); i++){
00613                 KHLABolometerRecord* bolo = GetBolo(i);
00614                 bolo->Compact();
00615         }
00616         for(Int_t i = 0; i < GetNumBoloPulses(); i++){
00617                 KHLABoloPulseRecord* bp = GetBoloPulse(i);
00618                 bp->Compact();
00619         }
00620         for(Int_t i = 0; i < GetNumMuonModules(); i++){
00621                 KHLAMuonModuleRecord* module = GetMuonModule(i);
00622                 module->Compact();
00623         }
00624 }
00625 
00626 //Easy Access / Event-Level Calculation Methods 
00627 
00628 Double_t KHLAEvent::GetSumBoloEnergyRecoil(void)
00629 {
00630         //Returns the sum of the recoil energies for all
00631         //bolometer sub-records in the event.
00632         
00633         Double_t energy = 0;
00634         for(Int_t i = 0; i < GetNumBolos(); i++)
00635                 energy += GetBolo(i)->GetEnergyRecoil();
00636         
00637         return energy;
00638 }
00639 
00640 Double_t KHLAEvent::GetSumBoloEnergyHeat(void)
00641 {
00642         //Returns the sum of the energy on the heat channel for all
00643         //bolometer sub-records in the event.
00644         
00645         Double_t energy = 0;
00646         for(Int_t i = 0; i < GetNumBolos(); i++)
00647                 energy += GetBolo(i)->GetEnergyHeat();
00648         
00649         return energy;
00650 }
00651 
00652 Double_t KHLAEvent::GetSumBoloEnergyIon(void)
00653 {
00654         //Returns the sum of the fEnergyIon for all
00655         //bolometer sub-records in the event. Note that in the ERA
00656         //processors, the calculation of fEnergyIon depends upon
00657         //the category of the event.
00658         
00659         Double_t energy = 0;
00660         for(Int_t i = 0; i < GetNumBolos(); i++)
00661                 energy += GetBolo(i)->GetEnergyIon();
00662         
00663         return energy;
00664 }
